meanings.sent1: After the chaos, they decided to reregulate the traffic.
meanings.sent2: The government plans to reregulate the industry to ensure fair competition.
meanings.sent3: The town council had to reregulate the noisy parades to avoid scaring the pets.
meanings.sent4: She had to reregulate her breathing after running up the stairs.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to reregulate the classroom after a surprise fire drill.

meanings.sent1: The reregulation of safety standards was necessary to protect workers.
meanings.sent2: The reregulation of the financial sector aimed to prevent another economic crisis.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected snowstorm led to the reregulation of school bus routes.
meanings.sent4: The reregulation of internet privacy laws was long overdue.
meanings.sent5: The reregulation of food labeling helped consumers make informed choices.
